name: Grand Hotel Casselbergh Bruges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our visit to Bruges, Belgium was greatly enhanced by our stay at this hotel. The service was all we could desire. The rooms in the new section were good-sized and well appointed, and the location provided quick access to the Burg and Grote Market. The breakfast buffet tempted one to eat too much. I'd recommend the Casselbergh to anyone visiting Bruges.
reviews.title: A Greart Location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just returned from this hotel again, its our third stay and once again it was wonderful, the hotel is now completely non smoking as is all of the hotels and bars in Bruges, the reception rooms are the most oppulent of any you will find in Bruges, the service superb and prices in the hotel are amongst the lowest we found in the local area. bottle of wine in hotel 19.50 euros, the cheapest we could find in a bar or restaurant was around 24 euros. the hotel was preparing for christmas last weekend, with all the decorations it looks fantastic but even woithout it is a stunning place, look on the website the pictures are totally honest views it really is that good througout the hotel not just a few rooms as you sometimes find. the car park is a little awkward to negotiate but so few hotels in bruge even have parking this is a real bonus. you will have a wonderful time if you decide to stay here.
reviews.title: another wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Hotel Casselbergh is a very opulent hotel set in the heart of Bruges. The hotel itself consists of 2 parts an original building and a recent rear extension. The original building hosts the reception, bar and lounge area’s along with some of the bedrooms and the extension houses meeting rooms, bedrooms and the breakfast room.
reviews.title: A Grand Hotel in a Grand setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was classified as a Quality room which meant that it overlooked the canal and was situated in the extension. The room was very well laid out with a large bathroom (separate shower and bath) and lots of room. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and large. Although modern some sympathies have been shown towards the old style of the original building and everything was well finished.
reviews.title: Opulent Hotel - Centrally Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is a buffet affair with a very good choice and quality offerings. Eggs (scrambled and boiled), sausages, bacon (American style – thin & crispy), cold meats, 5 different types of cheese, fresh fruit salad, yoghurts, pastries, etc.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-But no room Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is bang on in the centre of Old Town Brugge. Right next door to the Town House and the interesting Basilica of the Holy Blood, and within easy reach of the Church of Our Lady (with Michaelangelo Statue), starting point of organised river cruises, lots of chocolate shops, restaurants etc. We got a great room rate for Sunday to Monday, allowing for 3 people to stay (€ 175 incl. BF). On full-weekend or weekdays, the rate would be at least double. Breakfast is very good. Hotel is old style, in a fully revamped old building and opened less then 2 years ago. MIf you go by car, make a reservation up front, for € 20/night. 11 am checkout is a bit early I think, but you can remain parking until 3 pm.(check in time). They use a tricky parking elevator, so you will need to be comfortable driving your car in tight spaces.
reviews.title: Great hotel, fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our stay would be the welcoming lounges of the bar and library with beautiful furnishings, high ceilings and chandeliers. Being the end of autumn, we ended our afternoons with hot chocolate, then Armagnac after dinner in front of the fire in the main lounge, and were pleasantly surprised at the prices. All staff we encountered during our stay were friendly, helpful and efficient.
reviews.title: Really lovely hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was classical in style, well furnished and comfortable with the usual European double bed being king-size, single mattresses zipped together with two single doonas. The bathroom was one of the best we have ever used: well lit with a shower (with plate sized shower rose) separate to a decent sized bath (5’7” could easily stretch out with legs straight in hot water up to the chin), only let down by towels that were not quite fluffy or luxurious.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: One great advantage of the hotel is the quiet location just off the Burg and 2 minutes from the main market and shopping precinct. A Taxi from the train station is between €10 - €15 depending on the time of day/night, but with all streets being cobble would you want to walk it dragging a suitcase?
reviews.title: Brilliant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately no restaurant for meals except the breakfast buffet which had a modest selection of hot and cold but everything was fresh and plentiful. Bruges is full of places to eat but they fill up fast. Avoid the tourist traps on Markt by keeping a lookout for somewhere else to eat while you wander along the wonderful streets and canals, then go in and book a table ahead for the evening.
reviews.title: beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 11-12 July Deluxe room number 2209
reviews.title: Disappointed...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FREE WIFI
reviews.title: Wow...!!! What else can you say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Actually quite a disappointment. It’s a magnificent building but not at all located right by the canals (as pictured on the website). Receptionist on our arrival was exceptionally impolite, bitter and unhelpful. Room not too bad with partly view of the canal (from a distance). Bed comfortable. Bathroom fine and pretty good size, but simple. Room located in the new wing but lacked any charm. The bar area and adjoined rooms in the original building are fabulous. Restored to its original glamour. Hotel has a spa which never visited (was never given the code to enter). Looked nice through the door though. Modern gym facilities but no air-condition and located next to spa/sauna so very hot. If it wasn’t for the good deal (€114) wouldn’t have stayed here. Bruges is definitely worth a visit. Lovely and beautiful city. But one night is actually enough in my view. Also note it is a very expensive spot. Got the feeling all restaurants had agreed on same pricing (for instance, moules frites €22-24 everywhere!).
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I will not go on and on about how great this hotel is - YES it is FANTASTIC! Probably one of the best hotels we ever stayed in. I feel sorry for people who have to complain when they are not looking after their own stuff and then blaming the very friendly and helpful people in the hotel, but some you can never please.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway now that we know that the hotel is great I wish people would share more where they went for dinner in Bruges (or lunch). This beautiful city (which we will definitely visit again) is just soooo very expensive, you will struggle to find a main course under 20 Euro. This counts for more or less all restaurants that we saw, so I am interested to find out if anybody went to a restaurant that was good and ok in price. Here is our share: we went to Sale and Pepe which is in one of the side streets near the Market square. The Service was very good and the interior friendly. They have mainly Italian based food (no Pizza though) and you can still find dishes below 20 Euro and very tasty too.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fine hotel oozes character in great position in the heart of Brugge. Bar and reception rooms cozy and welcoming and decent value,with prices comparable to local bars .Bedrooms and bathrooms in excellent order and spotlessly clean . Christmas market and ice rink short stroll away together with numerous restaurants bars and shopping . Ideal for a short break
reviews.title: Quality in all areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was surprisingly easy to reach by car (driving in Brugge is a bit tricky) and taking the tiny "car lift" to the underground car park was quite an experience - I wouldn't recommend trying it with an SUV! The hotel is a very short walk from the Burg and the Grote Markt, the two main squares, and is well located otherwise as well for walking around Brugge (try to avoid driving anywhere there). The reception staff were nice, but checking in could have been a bit speedier. Overall we were quite happy with staff and they were helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: Elegant hotel with good location and comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The older part of the building is very pretty and grandiose. We had opted for a cheaper room, which was in the newer part of the hotel. Although the room maybe lacked some of the stateliness that I can presume (and see in photos) the rooms in the older part of the hotel have, it was still very comfortable with clean, fresh furniture and bed, and tasty decor.
reviews.title: Wallet stolen at this hotel; staff not helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a nice bar that can make you easily feel like an aristocrat, and the architecture with its stone arches and staircases is quite impressive elsewhere in the old part of the building. So your breakfast and a gym workout will have nice surroundings.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel for Christmas visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very pretty hotel, but when my wallet was stolen right before we left the hotel (after checking out), the staff was very unhelpful. They were speaking in another language to each other, so I couldn't understand what they were saying, they did not help me look for it, they did not call the police, and when I emailed to check if my wallet had turned up a few weeks later, they did not even bother to respond. I am sure that my wallet was stolen by someone on the staff, and they were covering it up. DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.
reviews.title: Very Unique!

description: The Grand Hotel Casselbergh Bruges has many qualities that will guarantee you a special stay. Rich history is combined with modern luxury. The location, at the heart of the historical centre of Bruges — a UNESCO world heritage city — with its wonderful mediaeval buildings and idyllic canals, make the hotel unique. This luxurious hotel has been created out of three historical residences. Breathe in and enjoy the atmosphere of a bygone age! To the rear, a new wing has been added with quality architecture that is perfectly integrated with the surrounding buildings. Attentive hospitality in an exclusive setting Grand Hotel Casselbergh**** has 118 elegant rooms. They combine modern luxury with the authentic charm of 18th-century Bruges. The hotel has various meeting rooms, 40 parking places, and a superbly appointed wellness centre in the 13th-century cellars. This romantic hotel is certain to enchant you and welcome you with its attentive hospitality.
